acqinfo.p: Gift; Cecily Lutes via Judith Griffin, Groton, NY; 1984; NM-34.84.
acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information

accessrestrict.p: Coll. No. 469 is open for research according to the regulations of Fenimore Art Museum Library.
accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions

bioghist.p: Cecily Irene Johnson was born to W. D. Johnson and Cecily J. Arries. Dodd married Robert Brosseau Lutes in 1919. They had two children, Mary J. and Willard Johnson. In 1948, Lutes married a second time to Kenneth L. Dodd. Except for a time in the late 1920s to the 1930s when she lived in Bedford, MA, Cecily Dodd seems to have lived her whole life in Cooperstown where she was active in the Native Daughters of Cooperstown.
bioghist.head: Biography/History

scopecontent.p: Contains research undertaken by Cecily Dodd pertaining to Cooperstown, Otsego County, NY including research notes and essays on the dwellings, individuals, businesses, schools, churches and ministers, notable news, and folktales and traditions of Cooperstown, 1838-1891, as well as on James Fenimore Cooper and Susan Fenimore Cooper. Also, a speech on the history of the Otsego County Fair in Cooperstown, 1817-1931, given by Cecily Dodd at a local history panel discussion, and a history of The Cooper House written Dora Crittenden, the daughter of the owner.
scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
